topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: Completion Queue Manager Registers

body.p: The following tables describe the Completion Queue Manager registers.

p.b: Queue Manager Operational State Timeout Period

field-desc.p: If the operational state transition exceeds (2 ^ MTIMEOUT) time_signal cycles, the queue manager is autodisabled.
Valid range is 1 to 20. Other values are disable timeouts.
This field should only be modified with the queue manager disabled. Otherwise, the results are undefined.

p.b: Queue Engine/Vector Operational State Timeout Period

field-desc.p: If the operational state transition exceeds (1 ^ ETIMEOUT) time_signal cycles, the queue engine/vector is autodisabled.
Valid range is 1 to 20. Other values are disable timeouts.
This field should only be modified with the queue manager disabled. Otherwise, the results are undefined.
Reserved

p.b: Completion Queue Back Pressure Shift Left

field-desc.p: This field is used to calculate the Completion Queue Backpressure Threshold. See Completion Queue Engine BPTHRESH field for the calculation.
This field should only be modified with the completion queue manager disabled. Otherwise, the results are undefined.
Reserved

Allows firmware to control the operational state of the completion queue manager. Modifying the value of this field causes the completion queue manager to transition to the specified operational state. A transition does not complete until the new operational state is reflected in the State (STATE) field in the corresponding Completion Queue Manager Status (CQMSTS) register.
Firmware must comprehend the possibility of an autonomous state transition to disabled due to an error.
Only permitted transitions are allowed. Others result in undefined operation.
See section Operational State Control and Status.
Reserved
This bit is set by hardware when the completion queue manager is disabled due to an error. See CQMUCERRSTS for the reason.
See for more information.
Contains the current operational state of the completion queue manager.
See the Operational State Control and Status section.
0: Disabled
1: Enabled
2: Quiesced
3: Paused

register.registerNameMore: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Status
register.registerBriefDescription: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Status

registerBody.registerDescription: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Status

field-desc.p: Each bit is set when its corresponding error is detected.
31:10 Reserved
9: CIV Autodisabled due to operational state transition timeout. See the CIVSTS register.
8: CQE Autodisabled due to operational state transition timeout. See the registers CQESTS.
7: CQM Autodisabled due to operational state transition timeout.
6: CQE Autodisabled due to doorbell error. See the register CQESTS.
5: CQM MIF corrected error.
4: CQM MIF is autodisabled.
3: CQM told to Autodisable by SQM because SQM went autodisabled.
2: CQM told to Autodisable due to AI global autodisable.
1: RAM double bit error.
0: RAM single bit error.
For information about CQM MIF, see .

register.registerNameMore: Completion Queue Manager Autonomous Disable Control
register.registerBriefDescription: Completion Queue Manager Autonomous Disable Control

registerBody.registerDescription: Completion Queue Manager Autonomous Disable Control

field-desc.p: When a bit is written to 1, the corresponding error in the CQMUCERRSTS register is masked from causing autonomous disable.

register.registerNameMore: Completion Queue Manager Top Autonomous Disable Control
register.registerBriefDescription: Completion Queue Manager Top Autonomous Disable Control

registerBody.registerDescription: Completion Queue Manager Top Autonomous Disable Control

field-desc.p: When a bit is written to 1, the corresponding error in the CQMUCERRSTS register is masked from causing the whole AI to go to autonomous disable.
To clear a whole AI autonomous disable:
1. For each manager (also known as engine), set all bits of AI*TOPAUTDISMSK.
2. For each manager, cleanup and clear all bits of AI*UCERRSTS.
3. For each manager, clear bits of AI*TOPAUTDISMSK as desired.
4. Return to normal operation.

register.registerNameMore: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Mask
register.registerBriefDescription: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Mask

registerBody.registerDescription: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Mask

field-desc.p: When a bit is written to 1, the corresponding error in the CQMUCERRSTS register is masked from causing an interrupt.

register.registerNameMore: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Software Trigger
register.registerBriefDescription: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Software Trigger

registerBody.registerDescription: Completion Queue Manager Uncorrected Error Software Trigger

field-desc.p: When a bit is written to 1, the corresponding bit is set in the CQMUCERRSTS register.
This bit must be written to 0 before clearing the corresponding CQMUCERRSTS bit.

register.registerNameMore: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Status
register.registerBriefDescription: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Status

registerBody.registerDescription: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Status

field-desc.p: Each bit is set when its corresponding error is detected.
The same errors are reported in CQMUCERRSTS. See CQMUCERRSTS for bit mapping. This allows errors to be configured as either corrected or uncorrected.

register.registerNameMore: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Mask
register.registerBriefDescription: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Mask

registerBody.registerDescription: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Mask

field-desc.p: When a bit is written to 1, the corresponding error in the CQMCERRSTS register is masked from causing an interrupt.

register.registerNameMore: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Software Trigger
register.registerBriefDescription: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Software Trigger

registerBody.registerDescription: Completion Queue Manager Corrected Error Software Trigger

field-desc.p: When a bit is written to 1, the corresponding bit is set in the CQMCERRSTS register.
This bit must be written to 0 before clearing the corresponding CQMCERRSTS bit.
Reserved
Contains the index of the embedded RAM on which the command written to the CMD field is performed. The index also corresponds to the bit index for CQMRAMSBESTS and CQMRAMDBESTS.
0: CQECTL
1: CQEBPCTL
2: CQEPCIEPRE
3: CQEPCIECTL
4: CQEUBASE
5: CQELBASE
6: CQETIME
7: CIVPCIEPRE
8: CIVPCIECTL
9: CIVUADDR
10: CIVLADDR
11: CIVDATA
12: CIVTIME
Reserved

When a value is written to this field, the corresponding operation is performed on the embedded RAM selected in the INDEX field. Selecting an unimplemented RAM index or command causes a NOP to be executed.
0: (NOP) No Operation
1: (SBE) Set corresponding single bit error status bit
2: (DBE) Set corresponding double bit error status bit
3: (ISBE) Inject true single bit error in the next value read from RAM
4: (IDBE) Inject true double bit error in the next value read from RAM
Others are Reserved

register.registerNameMore: CQM Embedded RAM Single Bit Error Status
register.registerBriefDescription: CQM Embedded RAM Single Bit Error Status

registerBody.registerDescription: CQM Embedded RAM Single Bit Error Status

field-desc.p: Associated with each embedded RAM is a status bit. A status bit is set whenever a single bit error is detected in that RAM. See CQMRAMECTL.INDEX for embedded RAM indices. Bits corresponding to unused indices are hardwired to zero.

register.registerNameMore: CQM Embedded RAM Double Bit Error Status
register.registerBriefDescription: CQM Embedded RAM Double Bit Error Status

registerBody.registerDescription: CQM Embedded RAM Double Bit Error Status

field-desc.p: Associated with each embedded RAM is a status bit. A status bit is set whenever a double bit error is detected in that RAM. See CQMRAMECTL.INDEX for embedded RAM indices. Bits corresponding to unused indices are hardwired to zero.

Specifies the PCIe completion interrupt aggregation time unit scale factor in units of 2x time_signal (internal) clock periods (nominally 2uS using a 650 MHz host interface clock). For example, if this field is 10, then the aggregation time unit will be 20 uS (that is, 2 * 1uS * 10).
A value of zero indicates a zero time period and thus disables time based aggregation.
This field should only be modified with the completion queue manager is disabled. Otherwise, the results are undefined.
Reserved
This field configures the NVMe INTMS/INTMC masking mechanism to mask the first 32 completion interrupt vectors as appropriate in the following ways:
0 Mask when either the CICFG.INTMSC[0:31] (MSI) or CIVCTL[0:31].MASK (MSI-X) bits are set
1 Mask only when CICFG.INTMSC[0:31] (MSI) bits are set
2 Mask only when (MSI-X) bits are set
3 RESERVED
This field only affects the first 32 (for MSI mode) out of a possible 1025 (in MSI-X mode) completion interrupt vectors.
This field should only be modified with the completion queue manager disabled. Otherwise, the results are undefined.

Indicates the number of completion interrupt vectors included in the vector search. It affects CIVCTL[*], CIVSTS[*], CIVEVENT[*] and CIVINVFO[*]. The shorter search range results in higher throughput, but less vectors supported.
1 1025 range is i=0 to 1024: CIV*[i]
This field should only be modified with the completion queue manager disabled. Otherwise, the results are undefined.
Reserved
Configures the PCIe Completion Interrupt mode.
0; MSI/MSI-X
1: INTX - only completion interrupt vector 0 is used in this mode.
This field should only be modified with the completion queue manager disabled. Otherwise, the results are undefined.
Configures the PCIe INTX mode. It is only used when INTMODE field is set to INTX.
0: INTA
1: INTB
2: INTC
3: INTD
This field should only be modified with the completion queue manager disabled. Otherwise, the results are undefined.
When this bit is set, PCIe completion interrupts are masked, starting with the next vector to be evaluated. PCIe completion interrupts already selected and in the output pipeline will be output.

p.b: NVMe Completion Interrupt Vector Mask Set/Clear

field-desc.p: This register is used to mask completion interrupts when using pin-based completion interrupts, single message MSI, or multiple message MSI. When using MSI-X, the completion interrupt mask table (CIVCTL[0:31].MASK) should be used to mask completion interrupts.

When read, this field returns the current completion interrupt mask value within the controller. If a bit has a value of a '1', then the corresponding completion interrupt vector is masked. If a bit has a value of '0', then the corresponding completion interrupt vector is not masked.
Host software shall not access this register when configured for MSI-X; any accesses when configured for MSI-X is undefined.
